<!channel> : working on installing mdns on the raspberry pi's for a bit.

sweet. also josh is going to take a picture of the bottom shelf with the camera at a new height (higher). not modifying the whole rig yet but just with a tripod to see if the result is worth going the distance in changing the rig
and then I'm going to set up a raspberry pi with a little transistor on a gpio pin inline with the fridge's reed switch. toggling the state of the gpio should turn on/off the fridge lights.
Cool.
I'm going to be done shortly
A file was shared
here are the pictures of the bottom shelf taken from different heights and angles
not sure if/how useful they are

i'm not sure if they are terribly helpful since we can't seem to see the whole width so we can't use them in a new composited image. however, the first couple of images 831 and 832 seems less like we're looking up at the drawers which is better. not sure if it's worth modifying the rig or not

oh definitely don't incorporate these with the others since they were taken from a different perspective with a different lens with a different sensor. Just wanted to give people some different perspectives on the bottom area to see if it's worth moving that camera up
and, <@U026103R3>, should we ask what "Look forward to seeing the image once they're dialed in. " means exactly? Is he mostly talking about the bottom image?
the processing hasn't been tuned either
which I think evans mentioned
i chatted with evans about that and he has plans to tweak the cropping of the shelves, and a couple of other tuning tweaks
i think we we do those adjustments evans is planning on and put up on basecamp what we consider the "dailed in" image and see if they still have questions/concerns
not sure if/how that camera is rotated
ok got the raspberry pi to change levels on the gpio pins. commands look like "gpio write 29 0" to set pin 29 to low "gpio write 29 1" to set pin 29 to high
hooking up transistor now to act as switch
LMK when you're ready for me to wire it up to automation
^ exciting!
transistor works. getting closer
